icon.contents: data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' width='18' height='18' viewBox='0 0 18 18'%3E%3Cimage xlink:href='data:image/png;base64,' x='0' y='0' height='100%25' width='100%25'/%3E%3C/svg%3E

properties.label: Operation
properties.description: Operation to be done

properties.label: AccountId
properties.description: AccountId of DocuSign

properties.label: Access Token
properties.description: Access Token for accessing the docusign resources. To get access token refer documentation.

properties.label: Base URI
properties.description: Enter Base URI. For e.g. Default Base URI is https://demo.docusign.net/

properties.label: Payload Type
properties.description: Select "Required Fields" if you want to send required payload else "Json" for entire payload in json format

properties.label: Recipient's Details
properties.description: Enter Recipient's detail in the format [{"name":"alex","email":"xyz@gmail.com","recipientId":"12","recipientType":"signers"}]

properties.label: Email Subject
properties.description: The subject of the email used to send the envelope.

properties.label: Upload Documents
properties.description: The list of map of paths and documentId of all the documents which needs be to signed. For e.g.[{"documentPath":"fullPath","documentId":"12"}]

properties.label: Status
properties.description: Set to "sent" to send the envelope to recipients.Set to "created" to save the envelope as a draft.

properties.label: Payload
properties.description: Enter the payload in json format

properties.label: Envelope Id
properties.description: Enter Envelope Id

properties.label: Addtional Fields
properties.description: Specifies additional information about the envelope to return. Enter a comma-separated list, such as tabs,recipients.

properties.label: Documents Paths
properties.description: Enter path of documents in the format [{"documentId":"12","documentPath":"C:/Users/user.png"}]

properties.label: Envelope Id's
properties.description: Enter Envelope Id's in the format [EnvelopeId1,EnvelopeId2]

properties.label: Username
properties.description: Limit results to envelopes sent by the account user with this username. "email" must be given as well

properties.label: Email
properties.description: Limit results to envelopes sent by the account user with this email. "Username" must be given as well

properties.label: UserId
properties.description: The ID of the user who created the envelopes to be retrieved. Note that an account can have multiple users, and any user with account access can retrieve envelopes by user_id from the account.

properties.label: Folder Types
properties.description: A comma-separated list of folder types you want to retrieve envelopes from. For e.g. ["inbox","draft","sentitems"]

properties.label: Status
properties.description: A comma-separated list of current envelope statuses to included in the response. For e.g.["sent","created","voided"]

properties.label: Search Text
properties.description: Free text search criteria that you can use to filter the list of envelopes that is returned

properties.label: Count
properties.description: The maximum number of results to return.

properties.label: From date
properties.description: Specifies the date and time to start looking for status changes. This parameter is required unless envelopeIds or transactionIds are set.

properties.label: To date
properties.description: Specifies the date and time to stop looking for status changes. The default is the current date and time

properties.label: order_by
properties.description: Sorts results according to a specific property

properties.label: Order
properties.description: Returns envelopes in either ascending (asc) or descending (desc) order.

properties.label: Other Fields
properties.description: If you want to add any other extra field, add it in the format [{"param1":"value1"},{"param2":"value2"}]

properties.label: Include in Response
properties.description: Specifies additional information to return about the envelopes in the format ["documents","recipients","folders"]

properties.label: Resend Envelope
properties.description: When true, forces the envelope to be resent if it would not be resent otherwise.

properties.label: Payload Type
properties.description: When true, forces the envelope to be resent if it would not be resent otherwise.

properties.label: Signers
properties.description: Enter the signers details in the format [{"email":"abc@gmail.com","name":"abc","recipientId":"1"}]

properties.label: carbonCopies
properties.description: Enter the CC's details in the format [{"email":"abc@gmail.com","name":"abc","recipientId":"1"}]

properties.label: inPersonSigners
properties.description: Enter the details in the format [{"name":"abc","hostname":"hostName","hostemail":"hostEmail@gmail.com"}]

properties.label: Certified Delivery
properties.description: Enter the details in the format [{"email":"abc@gmail.com","name":"abc","recipientId":"1"}]

properties.label: jsonPayload
properties.description: Enter the details in the format [{"email":"abc@gmail.com","name":"abc","recipientId":"1"}]

properties.label: Text Custom Field's
properties.description: An array of text custom fields. For e.g. [{"fieldId": "12","name": "textCustomField","required": "true","show": "true","value": "customFieldValue"}]

properties.label: List Custom Field's
properties.description: An array of list custom fields.

properties.label: Text Custom Field's
properties.description: An array of text custom fields. For e.g. []

properties.label: List Custom Field's
properties.description: An array of list custom fields. For e.g. []

properties.label: DocumentId
properties.description: The ID of the document to retrieve. Alternatively, you can use one of the following special keywords combined,archive,certificate,certificate. For more info refer docs

properties.label: Path
properties.description: Enter the path where to download the documents

properties.label: Document Name
properties.description: Enter the name of the documents to save as. Else the default name will be envelopeId_document

properties.label: Certificate
properties.description: When true, the certificate of completion is included in the combined PDF file. Note-Used only when the documentId parameter is the special keyword "combined".

properties.label: Show Changes
properties.description: When true, any changed fields for the returned PDF are highlighted in yellow and optional signatures or initials outlined in red.

properties.label: Language
properties.description: Specifies the language for the Certificate of Completion in the response For more info refer docs

properties.label: GroupId
properties.description: Enter the Id of the Group

properties.label: Payload Type
properties.description: Select Entire Payload if you want to add extra fields with request otherwise select userId's

properties.label: Payload
properties.description: Add the users details in json format. userName and email properties are neccessary. Refer the documentation for more details

properties.label: Payload
properties.description: Add the users details in json format. userName and email properties are neccessary. Refer the documentation for more details

properties.label: UserId's
properties.description: Enter the UserId's in the format ["userId1","userId2"]

properties.label: UserId's
properties.description: Enter the UserId's in the format ["userId1","userId2"] to delete

properties.label: Groups
properties.description: Set True if you want to delete the given users from all Groups also.

properties.label: PermissionSet
properties.description: Set True if you want to delete the given users from PermissionSet also.

properties.label: SigningGroupsEmail
properties.description: Set True if you want to delete the given users from SigningGroupsEmail also.

properties.label: UserId
properties.description: Enter the UserId

properties.label: Email
properties.description: Filters results based on the email address associated with the user that you want to return. You can use either this parameter or the email_substring parameter, but not both

properties.label: Email Substring
properties.description: Filters results based on a fragment of an email address. For example, you could enter gmail to return all users who have Gmail addresses.

properties.label: groupIds
properties.description: Filters results based on one or more group IDs. For eg ["groupId1","groupId2"]

properties.label: Not group ids
properties.description: Return user records excluding the specified group IDs.

properties.label: Status
properties.description: Filters results by user account status. status can be list of ActivationRequired,ActivationSent,Active,Closed,Disabled:

properties.label: Login status
properties.description: When true, the response includes the login status of each user.

properties.label: User Name Substring
properties.description: Filters the user records returned by the user name or a sub-string of user name.

properties.label: Count
properties.description: The maximum number of results to return.

properties.label: Additional Info
properties.description: When true, the custom settings information is returned for each user in the account. If this parameter is omitted, the default behavior is false.

properties.label: User Id
properties.description: User Id of the user

properties.label: Payload type
properties.description: Set "Basic Fields" if you want to update the basic fields else set "Entire Payload" and add data in Json format. Refer documentation

properties.label: First Name
properties.description: Update the first Name

properties.label: Middle Name
properties.description: Update the Middle Name

properties.label: Last Name
properties.description: Update the Last Name

properties.label: Job Title
properties.description: Update the Job title

properties.label: Company
properties.description: Update the company

properties.label: Language
properties.description: Update the Language

properties.label: Groups
properties.description: Update the groups.Enter the group Id in the format ["groupId1","groupId2"]

properties.label: Address 1
properties.description: Update the Address 1

properties.label: Address 2
properties.description: Update the Address 2

properties.label: City
properties.description: Update the City

properties.label: Country/Region
properties.description: Update the Country/Region

properties.label: Postal Code
properties.description: Update the Postal Code

properties.label: Phone
properties.description: Update the Phone

properties.label: Payload
properties.description: Enter the payload in Json Format

properties.label: Count
properties.description: The maximum number of results to return.

properties.label: Group Type
properties.description: The type of group to return. Valid values:AdminGroup, CustomGroup,EveryoneGroup

properties.label: Include Usercount
properties.description: When true, every group returned in the response includes a userCount property that contains the total number of users in the group. The default is true.

properties.label: Search Text
properties.description: The type of group to return. Valid values:AdminGroup, CustomGroup,EveryoneGroup

properties.label: Delete According to
properties.description: Set userId if you want to delete according to userId's of the users or select other for different combination

properties.label: UserIds
properties.description: Enter the userIds in the format ["userId1","userId1"]

properties.label: Payload
properties.description: Enter the fields in the format [{"userStatus":"Active","email":"abc@gmail.com"}]

properties.label: URL
properties.description: Enter the Api Endpoint

properties.label: Query Parameter
properties.description: Map of query parameters to add to the request URL

properties.label: Payload
properties.description: Payload to send with the request

properties.label: Result Variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in. Response should not be more than 32KB

properties.label: Result Expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables

properties.label: Error Expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation.
